sentences.en: A few of us in the press were there, goggle-eyed at the lavish hospitality.
sentences.cn: 我们几位记者当时在那里，眼馋地看着丰盛的茶点。

sentences.en: A rich man can be lavish of [ with ] his money.
sentences.cn: 富有的人用钱 大手大脚.

sentences.en: a royal palace on a lavish scale
Critics attack his lavish spending and flamboyant style.
sentences.cn: 评论家抨击他大肆挥霍、恣意张扬的作风。

sentences.en: He despised people who were lavish with their praises.
sentences.cn: 他看不起那些阿谀奉承的人.

sentences.en: He is lavish of his presents.
He staged the most lavish productions of Mozart.
sentences.cn: 他组织了一场空前盛大的莫扎特作品演奏会。

sentences.en: He was always a lavish spender.
It was a lavish reception as befitted a visitor of her status.
sentences.cn: 这场铺张的招待可算得正适合她这种身份的来访者。

sentences.en: Lavish gifts were bestowed on the visitors.
She'd been a bit too lavish with the salt, so the soup didn't taste nice.
sentences.cn: 她放盐太多, 因而汤的味道不太好.

sentences.en: Such lavish praise was hard to believe.
sentences.cn: 这样过度的赞扬使人难以置信.

sentences.en: The book drew lavish praise from literary critics.
sentences.cn: 文学评论家们对此书好评如潮。

sentences.en: The sets and costumes are lavish.
They lived a very lavish lifestyle .
sentences.cn: 他们过着挥霍无度的生活。

trans.tran_cn: 过分慷慨的，非常浪费的，过分丰富的，大量生产的

trans.tran_en: to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc
